title: In the problem of evil, why is there natural evil? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because the purpose of life is to grow souls fit for eternity. It's to produce beings who are Christlike, not Brad Pitt-like. (Not to diss the latter, but the pop conception of him as having the perfect (worldly) life.) How does one develop courage when there is nothing to fear and nothing to lose? How does one learn generosity when there's is no scarcity or want? How would compassion ever even be known if there was no pain or grief? Love without sacrifice is unintelligible.

Evil is common in humans but never natural, it is right brain anxiety driven extreme harmful/negative thought feeling and action. The faulty right brain wastes energy and blocks natural selection, it is unnatural by universal energy standards. EGMi maximises use of the energy efficiency left logical/positive brain so our goodness, some say EGMi is ahead of its time I say it has come maybe too late but I hope not.
